title: Using properties of logarithms to combine logarithmic terms
text: If one side of the equation has multiple logarithmic terms, combine them using properties of logarithms.

title: One-to-One property of logarithms
text: The One-to-One property of logarithms states that for any algebraic expressions S and T and any positive real number b, where b does NOT equal 1, log(base b)S $$=$$ log(base b)T if and only if $$S=T$$.

title: Extraneous solutions
text: Use the domain of the logarithmic function to determine whether a solution is extraneous.

title: Finding extraneous solutions
text: For what values of x will $$\ln(x^2-10)$$ be defined?
